The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
Here are some photos from today's media briefing on #COVID19

"Our message to all countries is: this is not one-way street. We can push this #coronavirus back. Your actions now will determine the course of the #COVID19 outbreak in your country. There’s no choice but to act now"-@DrTedros

"WHO is advising countries on actions they can take for each of the “3 Cs” scenarios: -1st case -1st cluster -1st evidence of community transmission. The basic actions in each scenario are the same, but the emphasis changes depending on which scenario a country is in"-@DrTedros
"For example, #China had community transmission in Wuhan, but relatively small numbers of cases in other provinces. Other countries have a similar pattern"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Some have rapidly expanding epidemics, with signs of community transmission. And some have declining epidemics, and have not reported a case for more than two weeks. Some countries have more than one of these scenarios at the same time"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"More than 130 countries have not detected any #COVID19 cases yet. Some just received their first cases yesterday. Some have clusters of cases, with transmission between family members and other close contacts"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"WHO will continue to provide evidence-based guidance to help countries and individuals to assess and manage their risk, and make decisions. There is no one-size fits all approach. Different countries are in different scenarios"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The answers to these questions will vary depending on where you live, how old you are, and how healthy you are. Individuals, families and communities should follow the advice provided by local health authorities and local health professionals"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"Is the #coronavirus spreading in my community? Will my kids be okay? Will my parents be okay? Is it safe to hold an event? Should I travel?"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"But we need to see this in perspective. Of the 88,913 #COVID19 cases reported so far, 90% are in , mostly in one province. We know people are afraid. We know they have many concerns and questions"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We appreciate that people are debating whether this is a pandemic or not. We are monitoring the situation every moment of every day & analyzing the data. WHO will not hesitate to describe this [#COVID19] as a pandemic if that’s what the evidence suggests"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"But containment of #COVID19 is feasible and must remain the top priority for all countries. With early, aggressive measures, countries can stop transmission and save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"If this [#COVID19] was an influenza epidemic, we would have expected to see widespread community transmission across the globe by now, and efforts to slow it down or contain it would not be feasible"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We are in unchartered territory. We have never before seen a respiratory pathogen that is capable of community transmission, but which can also be contained with the right measures"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"That’s important because it indicates that surveillance measures are working & ’s epidemic can still be contained. ’s situation also underlines that this is a unique virus with unique features. This virus is not influenza"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The Republic of #Korea has now reported over 4200 #COVID19 cases & 22 deaths, meaning it has more than half of all cases outside . However, the cases in appear to be coming mostly from suspected cases from the 5 known clusters, rather than the community"-@DrTedros
"A WHO staff member in our #Iran country office has now tested positive for #COVID19. He has mild disease"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"A WHO team arrived in #Iran this afternoon to deliver supplies and support the government in the #COVID19 response. I thank Crown Prince Sheikh @MohamedBinZayed of the United Arab Emirates for his support in making this mission possible"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"In the last 24 hours there were almost 9 times more #COVID19 cases reported outside #China than inside . The epidemics in the Republic of Korea, Italy, Iran and Japan are our greatest concern"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"The number of #COVID19 cases in continues to decline. Yesterday, reported 206 cases to WHO, the lowest since 22 January. Only 8 cases were reported outside Hubei province. Outside , a total of 8739 cases have been reported from 61 countries, with 127 deaths"-@DrTedros

For more information on how risk assessments are conducted, see WHO’s manual on Rapid Risk Assessment of Acute Public Health Events http://bit.ly/2PAcHSC

WHO concluded that the #COVID19 risk at regional & global levels was very high for reasons incl. the following: potential for major impact on health care systems of some affected and potentially affected countries in the future potential medical supply shortages

WHO concluded that the #COVID19 risk at regional & global levels was “very high” for reasons incl. the following: difficulty in identifying cases due to non-specific symptoms & the potential of undetected transmission limited testing capacity for COVID-19 in some countries

WHO concluded that the #COVID19 risk at regional and global levels was “very high” for reasons incl. the following: of intl spread of cases large clusters of cases currently reported in at least 4 countries outside #coronavirus
For the #COVID19 outbreak, WHO looked at a number of factors related to the #coronavirus, how it is spreading, and countries’ capacity to respond.

A risk assessment is a systematic process for gathering, assessing and documenting information to assign a level of risk. It provides the basis for taking action to manage and reduce the negative consequences of acute public health risks. #COVID19 #coronavirus

Since WHO systematized its approach to risk assessments in 2012, this is the first time that the risk associated with an event has been assessed as “very high” at the global level. #COVID19 #coronavirus
On 28 February, WHO raised the risk assessment for the #COVID19 outbreak internationally from “high” to “very high.” #coronavirus

Under the Intl Health Regulations, countries implementing additional health measures that significantly interfere with intl traffic shall notify WHO of the public health rationale of those measures within 48h. WHO #COVID19 Situation Report 28February http://bit.ly/2TswcxR

Promote regular teleworking across your organization. If there is an outbreak of #COVID19 in your community, the health authorities may advise people to avoid public transport & crowded places. #Teleworking will help your business keep operating while your employees stay safe.

Things to consider when you and your employees travel in time of #COVID19: Your employees should comply with any local restrictions on travel, movement or large gatherings http://bit.ly/2T0Ggim #coronavirus

Simple ways to prevent the spread of #COVID19 in your workplace: Brief your employees, contractors & customers that if #coronavirus starts spreading in your community anyone with even a mild cough or fever (37.3° C or more) needs to stay at home http://bit.ly/2T0Ggim
Simple ways to prevent the spread of #COVID19 in your workplace: Advise employees & contractors to consult national travel advice before going on business trips. http://bit.ly/2T0Ggim #coronavirus

Simple ways to prevent the spread of #COVID19 in your workplace: Promote good respiratory hygiene Ensure that and/or are available at your workplaces for those who develop a runny nose or cough at work - along with closed bins for hygienic disposal of them.

Simple ways to prevent the spread of #COVID19 in your workplace: Promote regular thorough hand-washing Put sanitizing hand rub dispensers in prominent places around the workplace & provide access to places where staff, contractors & customers can wash their hands with &

Simple ways to prevent the spread of #COVID19 in your workplace: Make sure your workplaces are clean & hygienic. Surfaces (e.g. desks & tables) & objects (e.g. , ) should be wiped with disinfectant regularly http://bit.ly/2T0Ggim #coronavirus

"Together, we are powerful. Containment starts with you. Our greatest enemy right now is not the #coronavirus itself. It’s fear, rumours and stigma. And our greatest assets are facts, reason and solidarity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

" it’s normal & understandable to feel anxious, especially if you live in a country or community that has been affected. Find out what you can do in your community. Discuss how to stay safe with your workplace, school or place of worship"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
" if you develop shortness of breath, call your doctor and seek care immediately"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
" if you are sick, stay at home, and eat and sleep separately from your family, use different utensils and cutlery to eat"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

" if you feel unwell, stay at home & call your . (S)he will ask Qs about your symptoms, where you have been & who you have had contact with. This will help to make sure you get the right advice, are directed to the right & will prevent you from infecting others"-@DrTedros

" if you are 60+ or if you have an underlying condition like: -cardiovascular disease -respiratory condition -diabetes you have a higher risk of developing severe #COVID19. You may wish to avoid crowded areas or places where you might interact with people who are sick"-@DrTedros
" if you cough or sneeze, do it into your sleeve, or use a tissue. Dispose of the tissue immediately into a closed rubbish bin, and then clean your hands"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

" avoid traveling if you have a fever or cough, and if you become sick while on a flight, inform the crew immediately. Once you get home, make contact with a health professional and tell them about where you have been"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Everyone should know the #COVID19 symptoms – for most people, it starts with a fever and a dry cough, not a runny nose. Most people will have mild disease and get better without needing any special care"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

" educate yourself about #COVID19. Make sure your information comes from reliable sources: your local or national public health agency, the WHO website, or your local health professional"-@DrTedros #coronavirus https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019
" clean surfaces regularly with disinfectant – for example kitchen benches and work desks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"There are 10 basic things that you should know. clean your regularly with an alcohol-based hand rub, or wash them with & . Touching your face after touching contaminated surfaces or sick people is one of the ways the #coronavirus can be transmitted"-@DrTedros

"Your risk depends on where you live, your age & general health. WHO can provide general guidance. You should also follow your national guidance and consult your local health professionals"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"We don’t need to wait for vaccines & therapeutics. There are things every individual can do to protect themselves & others today"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"At the same time, work is also progressing on vaccines and therapeutics. More than 20 vaccines are in development globally, and several therapeutics are in clinical trials. We expect the first results in a few weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"It calls for all countries to educate their populations, to expand surveillance, to find, isolate and care for every #COVID19 case, to trace every contact, and to take an all-of-government and all-of-society approach – this is not a job for the health ministry alone"-@DrTedros

"The report includes a wealth of information, and 22 recommendations for #China, for affected and unaffected countries, for the international community, and the general public"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The report of the WHO-#China Joint Mission has now published its report, which is available in ENG on the WHO website & will also be posted in CH on the National Health Commission website"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As I said yesterday, there are different scenarios in different countries, and different scenarios within the same country. The key to containing this #coronavirus is to break the chains of transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As long as that’s the case, we still have a chance of containing this #coronavirus, if robust action is taken to detect cases early, isolate and care for patients and trace contacts"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"What we see at the moment are linked epidemics of #COVID19 in several countries, but most cases can still be traced to known contacts or clusters of cases. We do not see evidence as yet that the virus is spreading freely in communities"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

The electronic #EssentialMedicines List is the latest step in WHO’s effort to harness digital technologies to drive improvements in global public health, and advance progress towards #HealthForAll. https://list.essentialmeds.org

The electronic #EssentialMedicines List allows users to search by simply clicking on the name of a medicine, for example, or a health issue. They can also make their own customized lists by exporting the list into an Excel or Word version. https://list.essentialmeds.org
Here are just a few of the ways WHO is responding to #COVID19. For our latest updates http://bit.ly/392wK3P

To strengthen global #COVID19 lab diagnostic capacity, WHO has procured a commercial assay with strong performance data, and shipped to over 150 laboratories globally as an interim measure for Member States requesting support. WHO Situation Report http://bit.ly/2T6XhYc
The new electronic version of the #EssentialMedicines List brings the traditional list to smartphones & computer screens in a comprehensive, freely accessible, online database.

WHO #EssentialMedicines List includes: information about available dose forms & strengths specifications as to who should take a medicine what conditions a medicine can treat & how it should be taken details about the clinical evidence supporting the recommendations
Since 1977, the WHO list of #EssentialMedicines has been revised every 2 years by a group of experts. The latest update was published in 2019 https://list.essentialmeds.org

#EssentialMedicines are those that: satisfy the priority health care needs of a population need to be available in a functioning health system at all times, in appropriate dosage forms, of assured quality, & at prices that individuals & the community can afford.
LIVE #AskWHO Q&A on #COVID19 in the workplace

Over 150 countries currently use the WHO list of #EssentialMedicines to work out which medicines best meet their national health contexts and priorities, so they can compile their own national essential medicines lists. https://list.essentialmeds.org/

An adequate and reliable supply of safe blood can be assured by a stable base of regular, voluntary, unpaid donors. This is the safest group of donors as the prevalence of bloodborne infections is lowest among this group.

"Fear and panic doesn’t help. People can have concerns and rightly so. People can be worried and rightly so. The most important thing is to calm down and do the right things to fight this very dangerous #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO stands ready to support every country to develop its national plan. Once again, this is not a time for fear. This is a time for taking action now to prevent #coronavirus infections and save lives now"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The guidelines also include key performance indicators, and the estimated resources needed to prepare for and respond to a cluster of up to 100 #COVID19 cases. This is not enough, so we will do more"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"We’ve issued operational guidelines, with concrete actions countries can take in eight key areas to prevent, detect and manage #COVID19 cases"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We’ve shipped testing kits to 57 countries and personal protective equipment to 85 countries who need it. We have trained more than 80,000 #healthworkers through our online courses, in multiple languages"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"Our message continues to be that this #coronavirus has pandemic potential and WHO is providing the tools to help every country to prepare accordingly"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"If the answer to any of these questions is no, your country has a gap that this #coronavirus will exploit. Even developed countries could be surprised"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"These are the questions that every health minister must be ready to answer now. These are the questions that will be the difference between 1 #COVID19 case and 100 cases in the coming days and weeks"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"It’s not usually a runny . In 90% of #COVID19 cases it’s a & in 70% of cases a dry cough. Are we ready to fight rumours & misinformation with clear & simple messages that people can understand?"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Are we ready to treat patients with severe or critical #COVID19? Do our hospitals & clinics have the right procedures to prevent & control #coronavirus infections? Do our people have the right information? Do they know what the disease looks like?"-@DrTedros

"Do our #healthworkers know how to take samples correctly from patients? Do we have the right measures at airports & border crossings to test people who are sick? Do our labs have the right chemicals that allow them to test samples? ..."-@DrTedros #coronavirus #COVID19

"How will we know if there are #COVID19 cases in other areas of the country? Is there a reporting system that health facilities are all using & a way to raise an if there is a concern? Do our #healthworkers have the training & equipment they need to stay safe? ..."-@DrTedros

"There are some vital questions that every country must be asking itself today. Are we ready for the first #COVID19 case? What will we do when it arrives? Do we have an isolation unit ready to go? Do we have enough medical oxygen, ventilators & other equipment? ..."-@DrTedros
"But we are not hopeless. We are not defenseless. There are things every country and every person can do"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Every country needs to be ready to: -detect #COVID19 cases early -isolate patients -trace contacts -provide quality clinical care -prevent hospital outbreaks & community transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"That doesn’t mean those countries won’t have more #COVID19 cases. As of Tuesday, both & had reported no cases for >2 weeks, but unfortunately both had new cases yesterday"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"There are several countries that have not reported a #COVID19 case for more than 2 weeks: , , , , , , and . Each of these countries is different & each shows that aggressive, early measures can prevent transmission before #coronavirus gets a foothold"-@DrTedros

"In Guangdong, , scientists tested more than 320,000 samples from the community and only 0.14% were positive for #COVID19. That suggests that containment is possible. Indeed, there are many countries that have done exactly that"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"But this #coronavirus is not influenza. With the right measures, it can be contained. That is one of the key messages from #China. The evidence we have is that there does not appear to be widespread community transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"The #COVID19 epidemics in the Islamic Republic of Iran, Italy and the Republic of Korea demonstrate what this #coronavirus is capable of"-@DrTedros

"My message to each of these countries is: this is your window of opportunity. If you act aggressively now, you can contain this #coronavirus. You can prevent people getting sick. You can save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We are at a decisive point. For the past 2 days, the number of new #COVID19 cases reported in the rest of the has exceeded the number of new cases in . And in the past 24h, 7 countries have reported cases for the first time: , , , , , & "-@DrTedros

Blood transfusion saves lives and improves health, but many patients requiring transfusion do not have timely access to safe blood. Providing safe & adequate should be an integral part of every country’s national health care policy & infrastructure. http://bit.ly/2I0rX7l

The World Health Organization has launched a new easy-to-access, digital version of its Model list of #EssentialMedicines. The move will revolutionize the way this core WHO reference tool is used Right pointing backhand https://list.essentialmeds.org/
WHO looks forward to working with partners to improve blood supply particularly in the low and middle-income countries where this is so urgently needed, and save lives. http://bit.ly/2T1bNAX
Progress in blood safety and availability has been slow in many parts of the , placing patients’ safety at risk and putting undue pressure on health workers. http://bit.ly/2T1bNAX

Blood transfusion and blood products are critical for: birth delivery for both the mother and baby the survival and quality of life of patients suffering from many life-threatening conditions treating severe injuries and carrying out medical and surgical procedures

WHO’s new action plan to speed up universal access to safe blood & blood products pulls together existing recommendations & recommends new improved ways of working. It’s the start of a 4-year collaborative effort to improve transfusion & blood-based therapies in all countries.
WHO steps up action to improve access to safe blood http://bit.ly/2T1bNAX

Governments, citizens, media, key influencers & communities have an important role to play in preventing & stopping stigma. We all need to be intentional & thoughtful when communicating on social media & other platforms, showing supportive behaviors around #COVID19. Do your part!

Stigmatization could potentially contribute to: more severe health problems ongoing transmission difficulties controlling infectious diseases during an epidemic http://bit.ly/3c4Pmm0 #COVID19 #coronavirus

Stigma can: Drive people to hide the illness to avoid discrimination Prevent people from seeking health care immediately Discourage them from adopting healthy behaviours http://bit.ly/3c4Pmm0 #COVID19 #coronavirus

Given that #COVID19 is a new disease, it is understandable that its emergence and spread cause confusion, anxiety and fear among the general public. These factors can give rise to harmful stereotypes. http://bit.ly/3c4Pmm0 #coronavirus

Stigma occurs when people negatively associate an infectious disease with a specific population. This means that people are being labelled, stereotyped, separated and/or experience loss of status and discrimination because of a potential negative affiliation with #COVID19.

Since the emergence of #COVID19 we have seen instances of public stigmatization among specific populations and the rise of harmful stereotypes. WHO Situation Report 24 February 2020 http://bit.ly/3c4Pmm0 #coronavirus

Here are some photos from today's media briefing on #COVID19
"#COVID19 is a shared threat. We can only face it together, and we can only overcome it together"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"I wish to thank the @EU_Commission for its contribution of 232 million euros, which demonstrates the kind of global solidarity that gives me hope"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"But there are at least 3 priorities: 3. We must protect countries that are the most vulnerable, by doing our utmost to contain epidemics in countries with the capacity to do it"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"But there are at least 3 priorities: 1. All countries must prioritize protecting #healthworkers 2. We must engage communities to protect people who are most at risk of severe disease,particularly the elderly and people with underlying health conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"There is no one-size-fits-all approach. Every country must make its own risk assessment for its own context"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Using the word pandemic now does not fit the facts, but it may certainly cause fear. We do not live in a binary, black-and-white world. It’s not either-or. We must focus on containment, while doing everything we can to prepare for a potential pandemic"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"What we see are epidemics in different parts of the world, affecting countries in different ways & requiring a tailored response. The sudden increase in new #COVID19 cases is certainly very concerning. I have spoken consistently about the need for facts, not fear"-@DrTedros

"For the moment, we are not witnessing the uncontained global spread of this #coronavirus, and we are not witnessing large-scale severe disease or death. Does this virus have pandemic potential? Absolutely. Are we there yet? From our assessment not yet"- @DrTedros #COVID19

"Our decision about whether to use the word “pandemic” to describe an epidemic is based on an ongoing assessment of the geographical spread of the virus, the severity of disease it causes and the impact it has on the whole of society"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"There’s a lot of speculation about whether these increases mean that this epidemic has now become a pandemic. WHO has already declared a PHEIC – our highest level of alarm – when there were less than 100 cases outside & 8 cases of human-to-human transmission"-@DrTedros

"Outside #China, there are now 2074 #COVID19 cases in 28 countries & 23 deaths. The sudden increases of cases in Italy, the Islamic Republic of Iran & the Republic of Korea are deeply concerning"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Dr Bruce Aylward will give more detail tomorrow on behalf of the joint team. But the key message that should give all countries hope, courage and confidence is that this #coronavirus can be contained"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The team also estimate that the measures taken in #China have averted a significant number of #COVID19 cases. The report contains a wealth of other information, highlights questions for which we still don’t have answers, & includes 22 recommendations"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"They found that the fatality rate is between 2%-4% in Wuhan, & 0.7% outside Wuhan. They found that for people with mild #COVID19 disease, recovery time is about two weeks, while people with severe or critical disease recover within three to six weeks"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"They found that the #COVID19 epidemic peaked & plateaued between the 23rd of January & the 2nd of February & has been declining steadily since then. They have found that there has been no significant change in the DNA of the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros
"The team has made a range of findings about the transmissibility of the #coronavirus, the severity of #COVID19 and the impact of the measures taken"-@DrTedros

"Earlier today the WHO-#China joint mission concluded its visit & delivered its report. As you know, the team has traveled to several different provinces, including Wuhan"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As of 6am GVA time this morning, #China has reported a total of 77,362 cases of #COVID19 to WHO, including 2618 deaths. In the past 24 hours, has reported 416 new confirmed cases & 150 deaths. We’re encouraged by the continued decline in cases in "-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"I assure you that WHO is committed to working with all African countries to do everything we can to prevent transmission, and detect and treat cases as early as possible"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The increasing signs of transmission outside #China show that the window of opportunity we have for containing this #coronavirus is narrowing. We are calling on all countries to invest urgently in preparedness"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We have also held two calls with @UN resident coordinators all over the world, to brief them on the actions they can take to prepare their countries and ensure the United Nations system is working as one"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"2 weeks ago I briefed @UN SG @antonioguterres & we agreed to activate the UN Crisis Management Team, led by @DrMikeRyan, to enable WHO to focus on the health response while other agencies bring their expertise to bear on the other implications of the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros

"We’re also providing advice to countries on how to do screening, testing, contact tracing & treatment. Last week we brought the intl. research community together to identify research priorities, especially in the areas of diagnostics, therapeutics & vaccines"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"During the past month about 11,000 African #healthworkers have been trained using WHO’s online courses on #COVID19, which are available free of charge in English, French & other languages at http://OpenWHO.org"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We’re working with manufacturers of personal protective equipment [PPE] to address the severe disruption in the market for masks, gloves, gowns and other PPE, to ensure we can protect #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We’ve also shipped more than 30,000 sets of personal protective equipment to six countries in Africa, and we’re ready to ship almost 60,000 more sets to 19 countries in the coming weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Some countries in Africa, including , are also leveraging the capacity they have built up to test for #Ebola to test for #COVID19. This is a great example of how investing in health systems can pay dividends for health security"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Increasing number of African countries are now able to test for #COVID19 with laboratory test kits supplied by WHO, compared with only two labs just a couple of weeks ago"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We’ve published a Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan, with a call for US$675m to support countries, especially the most vulnerable. WHO has identified 13 priority countries in Africa because of their direct links to #China or the high volume of travel with "-@DrTedros

"We have just appointed Dr @JNkengasong, Director @AfricaCDC & Prof Samba Sow, Director-General of the Center for Vaccine Development in , as special envoys on #COVID19, to provide strategic advice and high-level political advocacy & engagement in Africa"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Our biggest concern continues to be the potential for #COVID19 to spread in countries with weaker health systems. In partnership with the @AfricaCDC, we’re working hard to prepare countries in Africa for the potential arrival of the virus"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"In 2% of reported cases, the #coronavirus is fatal, and the risk of death increases the older a patient is, and with underlying health conditions. We see relatively few cases among children. More research is needed to understand why"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"20% of patients have severe or critical #COVID19, ranging from shortness of breath to septic shock & multi-organ failure. These patients require intensive care using equipment such as respiratory support machines that are in short supply in many African countries"-@DrTedros
"With every day that passes, we know a little bit more about this #coronavirus & the disease it causes. We know that more than 80% of patients have mild disease & will recover"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"As you know, a WHO-led international team of experts – including a representative from the @NCDCgov – has been on the ground in #China for the past week"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We are especially concerned about the increase in cases in the Islamic Republic of #Iran, where there are now 18 cases & 4 deaths in just the past two days. WHO has supplied testing kits to & we will continue to provide further support in the coming days & weeks"-@DrTedros

"Although the total number of #COVID19 cases outside #China remains relatively small, we are concerned about the number of cases with no clear epidemiological link, such as travel history to or contact with a confirmed case"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Outside , there are now 1200 cases in 26 countries, with 8 deaths. As you know, there is one confirmed case on the African continent, in . Several African countries have tested suspected cases of #COVID19, but fortunately they have been found negative"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

" has now reported 75,569 #COVID19 cases to WHO, including 2239 deaths. The data from continue to show a decline in new cases. This is welcome news, but it must be interpreted very cautiously. It’s far too early to make predictions about this outbreak"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"As you know, WHO declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern less than a month after the first reported #COVID19 cases, as a result of the signs of human-to-human transmission we saw outside #China"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"In just 7 weeks, the #COVID19 outbreak has captured the ’s attention, and rightly so, because it has the potential to cause severe political, social & economic upheaval"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"It’s hard to believe that only 52 days ago, WHO’s country office in #China was notified of a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause in Wuhan city"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We must not look back and regret that we failed to take advantage of the window of opportunity we have"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The measures #China & other countries have taken have given us a fighting chance of containing the spread of the #coronavirus. We call on all countries to continue their containment measures, while preparing for community transmission if it occurs"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As I said yesterday, WHO’s key role is coordinating the global response to the epidemic & our new special envoys will help us to do that. This is another step we are taking to take advantage of the window of opportunity we have to contain the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros

"... Dr @JNkengasong, Director @AfricaCDC Dr Mirta Roses, former Director @pahowho Dr Shin Young-soo, former Director @WHOWPRO Prof Samba O. Sow, Director-General Center for Vaccine Development in "-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"I’m pleased that the following eminent individuals have accepted my invitation to act in this role: Prof Dr Maha El Rabbat, former Minister of Health of Dr @davidnabarro, special adviser to the @UN Secretary-General on the @GlobalGoalsUN & Climate Change ..."-@DrTedros

"I’m also pleased to announce that today we are appointing four special envoys on #COVID19, to provide strategic advice and high-level political advocacy and engagement in different parts of the world"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We are working with all of partners under the GOARN network to safeguard the health of the members of the team, and to take appropriate measures when they return to their countries of origin"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Meanwhile, the WHO-led joint mission in #China has been working in Beijing, Sichuan and Guangdong, and will travel to Wuhan tomorrow to continue its work at the epicenter of the outbreak"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Our concern continues to be the potential for #COVID19 to spread in countries with weaker health systems. Tomorrow I will address an emergency meeting of African health ministers, held jointly by the African Union and the @AfricaCDC"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We are also concerned about the increase in #COVID19 cases in the Islamic Republic of #Iran, where there are now 18 cases and four deaths. WHO has supplied testing kits, and will continue to provide further support"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Apart from the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship, the Republic of #Korea now has the most cases outside #China, and we’re working closely with the government to fully understand the transmission dynamics that led to this increase"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Although the total number of #COVID19 cases outside remains relatively small, we are concerned about the number of cases with no clear epidemiological link, such as travel history to or contact with a confirmed case"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Outside #China, there are now 1152 #COVID19 cases in 26 countries & 8 deaths"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Although the number of #COVID19 cases in Hubei province continues declining, we are concerned about an increase in the number of cases in Shandong province, and we are seeking more information about that"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"This may indicate because the health system in Wuhan, have regained the ability to test all suspected #COVID19 cases. As a result, some cases that had been clinically confirmed have now been subtracted from the total because they have tested negative"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"The significant in confirmed cases is partly due to another change in the way reports numbers. Last week started reporting clinically-diagnosed cases, in addition to lab-confirmed cases. They have now switched back to reporting suspected & lab-confirmed cases"-@DrTedros

"As of 6am GVA time this morning, #China has reported a total of 75,567 cases of #COVID19 to WHO, including 2,239 deaths. In the past 24 hours, has reported 892 new confirmed cases and 118 deaths"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"You will get sick of me saying that the window of opportunity remains open for us to contain this #COVID19 outbreak. WHO is doing everything we can to seize that window of opportunity, and we urge the international community to do the same"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"We’re partnering with the @AfricaCDC to coordinate our efforts to prepare African countries for the potential arrival of the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Today we had a call with faith-based organizations as another way of reaching communities with messages to prevent #coronavirus infection"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"I’ve written to 12 chief executives of manufacturers of personal protective equipment to seek their cooperation to ensure supply to protect #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We’re also looking forward to results from two clinical trials of therapeutics prioritized by the WHO R&D Blueprint. One combines two drugs for HIV, lopinavir & ritonavir & the other is testing an antiviral called remdisivir. We expect preliminary results in 3 weeks"-@DrTedros

"We’ve also set up an online platform where clinicians can share anonymized patient data, so we can build a clearer picture of the disease. What we’re seeing is that the earlier patients are tested and treated, the better they do"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Twice a week we have a call with clinical experts who are treating patients with #COVID19, including front-line workers in #China, to share information about the progression of disease and what works and what doesn’t in treatment"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Today we are holding a second call with @UN country representatives, to brief them on the measures they can take at country level to coordinate the UN #COVID19 response"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Two weeks ago, I briefed the @UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres and we agreed to activate the United Nations Crisis Management Team, led by @DrMikeRyan"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Yesterday we held the first of what will be weekly briefings with diplomatic missions here in Geneva, to keep our Member States informed – and we are holding these daily news briefings to keep the media informed"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We’ve convened the WHO Health Security Council, a daily meeting of myself, @DrMikeRyan, the Regional Directors & other senior staff, to review the evolution of the #COVID19 outbreak and coordinate the response"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"[Experts are] from the following institutions: @NUSingapore @SNUCM_Official @NCDCgov @CDCgov @NIH @rki_de The St Petersburg Pasteur Institute The Natl Institute of Infectious Diseases The Natl Medical Research Center of Phthisiopulmonology & Infectious Diseases"-@DrTedros

"The team has been brought together through the Global Outbreak Alert and Response Network, and includes experts in epidemiology, virology, clinical management, outbreak control and public health"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As you know, a WHO-led international team of experts is now on the ground in #China, working with their Chinese counterparts to find answers to some of the things we don’t know, including the transmissibility of the virus & the impact of the measures that has taken"-@DrTedros

"In addition to monitoring the evolution of the #COVID19 outbreak, WHO’s main role is to work with countries and partners to coordinate the global response. We’re doing that in several ways, both internally and externally"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"#Japan is in regular contact with other countries through a mechanism set up under the International Health Regulations, so those countries can follow up with their nationals who were passengers on the ship"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"#Japan has also advised passengers to stay at home for a further 14 days and monitor their temperature and has set up a hotline for passengers to call if they have concerns"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Of all cases outside #China, over 1/2 are among passengers on the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship. The first passengers have now disembarked, providing they have a negative test, no symptoms and no contact with a confirmed case in the past 14 days"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Outside #China, there are now 1076 #COVID19 cases in 26 countries, with seven deaths. In the past 24 hours the Islamic Republic of #Iran has reported 5 cases, 2 of which have died"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"As of 6am GVA time this morning, #China has reported 74,675 cases of #COVID19 to WHO, including 2121 deaths. The data from continue to show a decline in new cases. Once again, we’re encouraged by this trend, but this is no time for complacency"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"#ClimateChange poses an existential threat to every child’s health & future. They are more likely to get sick from diarrhea, malaria or dengue when flood waters surge; & more likely to suffer severe heatstroke as temperatures rise"-@DrTedros #ClimateAction

"Babies are about 20% more likely to be delivered with the assistance of a nurse or midwife than they were in 2000, vastly increasing their chance of surviving those critical first days"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives
"Close to 9 in 10 children born today receive vaccines that protect them against some leading childhood killers"-@DrTedros #VaccinesWork

"As this report shows, we’ve seen real progress in improving child health, but we also face serious challenges. Around 8 million more children & adolescents are surviving than they were 30 years ago"-@DrTedros

"We’re working with partners in some of the most fragile contexts to prepare countries for the arrival of the #coronavirus. We still have a chance of preventing a broader global crisis. WHO will continue working night & day with all countries to prepare them"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Other countries like , & are running workshops with the media to ensure accurate & reliable reporting. Several countries are prioritizing surveillance and monitoring at ports of entry, including , , , , and "-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Some countries in @WHOAFRO including #DRC are now leveraging the capacity they have built up to test for Ebola to test for #COVID19. This is a great example of how investing in health systems can pay dividends for health security"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Many of these countries have been sending samples to other countries for testing, waiting several days for results. Now they can do it themselves, within 24-48 hours"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"By the end of the week, 40 countries in @WHOAFRO and 29 in @pahowho are due to have the ability to detect #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Many countries are taking steps to prepare themselves, with WHO support. We’ve shipped supplies of personal protective equipment to 21 countries & will ship to another 106 countries in the coming weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"These signals show the importance of all countries being ready for the arrival of the #coronavirus, to treat patients with dignity & compassion, to protect #healthworkers & to prevent onward transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"I also spoke to the Minister of Health of #Malaysia to discuss the #Westerdam case and other aspects of their preparations"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"#Singapore is leaving no stone unturned, testing every case of influenza-like illness and pneumonia. So far they have not found evidence of #COVID19 community transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Yesterday I spoke to #Singapore’s Minister of Health and we are very impressed with the efforts they are making to find every #COVID19 case, follow up with contacts, and stop transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We’re following up with countries to get more information about what happens about each #COVID19 case & the outcome. However, we have not yet seen the sustained local transmission, except in specific circumstances like the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"So far there are 92 #COVID19 cases in 12 countries outside #China of human-to-human transmission. At the moment we don’t have enough data on cases outside to make a meaningful comparison on the severity of disease or the case fatality rate"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We have now had cases of #COVID19 outside #China for more than a month. We are supporting national authorities in every country that has cases to track the virus and understand how people were infected"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"In the past 24 hours, there have been 110 new #COVID19 cases outside #China, including 99 on the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"As of 6am GVA time this morning, #China has reported 72,528 #COVID19 cases to WHO, incl. 1870 deaths. In the past 24h, has reported 1,891 new cases, including both clinically- & lab-confirmed cases. Outside , there are now 804 cases in 25 countries, with 3 deaths"-@DrTedros
"Although we are now devoting a lot of attention to #COVID19, WHO is still responding to many other emergencies around the world"-@DrTedros

"In the coming days, WHO is sending essential medicine & supplies across the border from to #Syria. We are sending supplies for trauma, intensive & surgical care to Idleb & Aleppo governorates; in addition to drugs for non-communicable diseases & #PrimaryHealthCare"-@DrTedros

"Nearly 900k people have been displaced, including half a million children. Children are particularly prone to hypothermia & respiratory tract infections & due to lack of shelter, many of them are sleeping in the open with their families, exposed to the elements"-@DrTedros #Syria

"2 attacks on health facilities took place yesterday afternoon, on 2 separate hospitals in Aleppo. Luckily, there were no casualties. We repeat: health facilities & #healthworkers are #NotATarget in conflict & attacks on health are a breach of international law"-@DrTedros

"I’d like to start today by talking not about #COVID19, but about #Syria. Since the 1st of December, dozens of health facilities have suspended services in the Idleb & Aleppo areas. Out of nearly 550 health facilities in northwest Syria, only about half are operational"-@DrTedros

"We’ve put out a call for $675 million to support countries to prepare. I thank those donors who have contributed. We have a window of opportunity. We don’t know how long it will remain open. Let’s not squander it"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We’re protecting #healthworkers by sending personal protective equipment to many countries & working with manufacturers to ensure supply. We’re training health workers. We’re providing advice to countries on how to do screening, testing, contact tracing & treatment"-@DrTedros
"WHO is continuing to work night and day on several fronts to prepare countries. We’re sending testing kits to laboratories around the "-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"We thank all partners who have made their experts available through the GOARN framework"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"The international team of experts now on the ground in #China is working with Chinese counterparts to better understand address those gaps and improve our understanding of the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"In 2% of reported #COVID19 cases, the virus is fatal & the risk of death increases the older you are. We see relatively few cases among children. More research is needed to understand why. These new data address some of the gaps in our understanding, but others remain"-@DrTedros

"Over 80% of patients have mild #COVID19 & will recover. In about 14% of cases, the virus causes severe disease, including pneumonia & shortness of breath. And about 5% of patients have critical disease incl. respiratory failure, septic shock & multi-organ failure"-@DrTedros

"It’s too early to tell if this reported decline will continue. Every scenario is still on the table. It also appears that #COVID19 is not as deadly as other coronaviruses including SARS and MERS"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"The data also appear to show a decline in new #COVID19 cases. This trend must be interpreted very cautiously. Trends can change as new populations are affected"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"They [the data] are very important in enabling WHO to provide good evidence-based advice to countries. We encourage all countries to share their data publicly"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

“This is a time for facts, not fear. This is a time for rationality, not rumours. This is a time for solidarity, not stigma”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“In our fractured and divided , health is one of the few areas in which international cooperation offers the opportunity for countries to work together for a common cause”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“We have a choice. Can we come together to face a common and dangerous enemy? Or will we allow fear, suspicion and irrationality to distract and divide us?”-DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“It’s easy to blame. It’s easy to politicize. It’s harder to tackle a problem together, and find solutions together. We will all learn lessons from this #COVID19 outbreak. But now is not the time for recriminations or politicization”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

“Too much has been written & said about my praise for . I have given credit where it’s due & I will continue to do that, as I would for any country that fights an outbreak aggressively at its source to protect its own people & the , even at great cost to itself”-@DrTedros

“ we must be guided by solidarity, not stigma. The greatest enemy we face is not the #coronavirus itself; it’s the stigma that turns us against each other. We must stop stigma and hate!”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19

“Now more than ever is the time for us to let science and evidence lead policy. If we don’t, we are headed down a dark path that leads nowhere but division and disharmony”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“In many countries, measures have been taken by one part of government without appropriate consultation with the health ministry, or consideration of the impact of those measures”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“ this is not a job for the health minister alone. It takes a whole-of-government approach. But that approach must be coherent and coordinated, guided by evidence and public health priorities”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“We call on all governments, companies and news organizations to work with us to sound the appropriate level of alarm, without fanning the flames of hysteria.”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“That’s why we’re also working with search & media companies like @Facebook, @Google, @Pinterest, @TencentGlobal, @Twitter, @tiktok_us, @YouTube and others to counter the spread of rumours & misinformation”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus #KnowtheFacts
“We’re not just fighting an epidemic; we’re fighting an infodemic. Fake news spreads faster and more easily than this #coronavirus & is just as dangerous”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #COVID19

“WHO is working with manufacturers & distributors of personal protective equipment to ensure a reliable supply of the tools health workers need to do their job safely and effectively”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

“ has bought the world time. We don’t know how much time. All countries must be prepared for the arrival of #COVID19 cases, to treat patients with dignity and compassion, and to prevent onward transmission & to protect healthworkers”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus
“Today, I have requests for the international community. we must use the window of opportunity we have to intensify our preparedness”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus
“This is frankly difficult to understand, and dangerously short-sighted”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“The spends billions of preparing for a terrorist attack, but relatively little preparing for the attack of a , which could be far more deadly & far more damaging economically, politically & socially”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“For too long, the world has operated on a cycle of panic and neglect. We throw money at an outbreak, and when it’s over, we forget about it and do nothing to prevent the next one”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“Two years ago, @WHO & @WorldBank founded the Global Preparedness Monitoring Board, an independent body to assess the state of the ’s readiness for a pandemic. Last year the board published its 1st report, which concluded the world remains dangerously unprepared.”-@DrTedros
“The outbreaks of both #Ebola and #COVID19 underscore once again the vital importance for all countries to invest in preparedness, not panic”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus
“And most of all, we’re concerned about the potential havoc this #coronavirus could wreak in countries with weaker health systems”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19
“We’re concerned about the level of rumours and misinformation that are hampering the #COVID19 response”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

“We’re concerned about the severe disruption in the market for personal protective equipment, which is putting front line health workers and carers at risk”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus
“We’re concerned by the lack of urgency in funding the #COVID19 response”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus
“We’re concerned by reports from China yesterday about the number of health workers who have been infected or have died”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus
“But we also have several concerns. We’re concerned by the continued increase in the number of #COVID19 cases in #China”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

“We’re encouraged that an international team of experts is now on the ground in #China, working closely with their Chinese counterparts to understand the #COVID19 outbreak, and to inform the next steps in the global response”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

“We’re encouraged that we have been able to ship #COVID19 diagnostic kits, as well as supplies of masks, gloves, gowns and other personal protective equipment to some of the countries that need it most”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

“We’re encouraged that the global research community has come together to identify and accelerate the most urgent research needs for #COVID19 diagnostics, treatments and vaccines”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus
“We’re encouraged that outside #China, we have not yet seen widespread #COVID19 community transmission”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“We are encouraged that the steps #China has taken to contain the #COVID19 outbreak at its source appear to have bought the world time, even though those steps have come at great cost to itself”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus
“Let me be clear: it is impossible to predict which direction this #COVID19 outbreak will take. What I can tell you is what encourages us, and what concerns us”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

“The second of these scenarios is what we are seeing now with the outbreak of #COVID19. With 99% of cases in #China , this is still very much an emergency for that country”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus
“ the deliberate or accidental release of biological agents – a hopefully rare event for which we must nonetheless be prepared”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020
" The emergence of a pathogen with pandemic potential, moving rapidly from country to country and requiring an immediate and large-scale response in countries”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020
“In the last few years, 80% of outbreaks requiring an international response have occurred in countries affected by fragility, conflict and insecurity"-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“There are main scenarios in which a coordinated response between the health & security sectors is essential: high-impact epidemics in situations of conflict and insecurity, such as #Ebola"-@DrTedros at #MSC2020
“Health security is therefore not just the health sector’s business. It’s everybody’s business”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“Without peace, health can be an unattainable dream. But the opposite can also be true: epidemics have the potential to cause severe political, economic & social instability & insecurity”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“It was no coincidence: •the 1918 #flu pandemic erupted in the middle of the WW I •the final frontier for eradicating #polio is in the most insecure regions of & •#Ebola has spread in the most insecure region of DRC” -@DrTedros #MSC2020
“This experience illustrates a key lesson of history: disease and insecurity are old friends.”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

“This epidemic stands in stark contrast to the previous #Ebola outbreak in the western part of DRC in 2018, an area that is relatively stable and peaceful. That outbreak was controlled in just three months”-@DrTedros at #MSN2020

“We are finally starting to see the possibility of ending this #Ebola outbreak in #DRC, after more than 18 months & the loss of 2,249 lives. In the past week there has been just 1 case, compared with 120 cases a week at the peak of the outbreak in April”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020
"I’d like to thank the President for his leadership & for his vision of a healthier & safer #DRC"-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

Yesterday I was in Kinshasa, in #DRC, meeting with the President & other senior ministers to review progress against the #Ebola outbreak & to work together on a plan to strengthen ’s health system so that it never sees another outbreak like this again”-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

"I wish to thank #Cambodia for demonstrating to the world the meaning of solidarity. While other countries turned away the #Westerdam cruise ship, allowed it to dock"-@DrTedros from #DRC #COVID19
"We’re working with our Chinese counterparts on these issues, and this is also part of the scope of work for the WHO-led joint mission with #China"-@DrTedros from #DRC #COVID19

"Clearly this is an evolving picture. #HealthWorkers & responders in #China are working with virtually no sleep in difficult conditions. But we need to ensure that we’re getting the most accurate data, as quickly as possible, to assist & support the global response"-@DrTedros

"It will be important to review which type of information is needed so that the world can use this window of opportunity to prepare health systems and workers for possible outbreaks"-@DrTedros from #DRC #COVID19
"Particular attention will be paid to understanding the transmission of the virus, the severity of disease & the impact of ongoing response measures"-@DrTedros from #DRC
"The goal of the joint mission is to rapidly inform the next steps in the #COVID19 response & preparedness activities in #China & globally"-@DrTedros from #DRC

"The Joint Mission will include in-depth workshops, a data review with the principal ministries, meetings with key national-level institutions & field visits in three provinces to understand the application & impact of response activities at provincial & county levels"-@DrTedros

"I’m glad to say that the WHO-led Joint Mission with on #COVID19 is moving forward. We expect the full team to touch down over the weekend. The mission consists of 12 international & WHO experts & a similar number of national expert counterparts from #China"-@DrTedros

"We have been in regular contact with suppliers, asking them to prioritize production and distribution of personal protective equipment to #healthworkers on the front lines. We are also in touch with Member States on this important issue"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"WHO guidelines have been developed for #healthworkers taking care of hospitalised adults and paediatric patients with acute infections. These guidelines have been made available to all countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Rest assured, the @UN, WHO and all our partners in the international community will be with you every step of the way as we strive to promote health, keep the world safe, serve the vulnerable"-@DrTedros in #DRC #HealthForAll

"This positive and powerful shift can increase the health system’s capacity to prepare for, and respond to, any health emergency, in line with the newly validated National Action Plan for Health Security"-@DrTedros in #DRC

"The transition from #Ebola to universal health coverage provides a unique opportunity to strengthen the entire #DRC health system, as long as the political commitment translates into the adequate & progressive mobilization of domestic resources"-@DrTedros

"... To strengthen the "Health in all policies" approach to reduce the burden of disease & ensure the sustainability of the system To foster good governance & management of the national system To Mobilize the resources needed to implement #HealthForAll"-@DrTedros in #DRC

"WHO stands ready to support #DRC in implementing the Strategic Universal Health Coverage Plan, and achieving its main objectives: To improve health service delivery across all levels of the health system; To provide financial protection to all people"-@DrTedros
"But achieving universal health coverage is first and foremost a political choice. That is the choice we are seeing here today"-@DrTedros in #DRC #HealthForAll
"It also means: -access to skilled #healthworkers & safe, effective & affordable medicines -sustained investment to build & equip hospitals, clinics and laboratories"-@DrTedros in #DRC #HealthForAll
"Most importantly, that means building a strong #PrimaryHealthCare system that can reach all communities with services to promote health, prevent disease and provide treatment"-@DrTedros in #DRC

"Ultimately, the best defense against any outbreak is a strong health system. That is why we’re here. We must work together to strengthen the health system of #DRC to promote & protect the people of this great country – because that is what they deserve"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"Much of our effort has been focused in the African continent as we bolster health systems to be able to respond if needed, while laying the groundwork where needed for stronger emergency preparedness"-@DrTedros in #DRC

"Therefore, we are focusing our efforts on strengthening diagnostic capacities & delivering supplies like masks, gloves and aprons to protect #healthworkers who care for people who have contracted the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros in #DRC
"We are most concerned about communities and countries, that have weaker health systems, which in turn may be more vulnerable to the import of the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros in #DRC
"Like with #Ebola in eastern , our strategy is to hammer #COVID19 at its epicenter in , where 99% of all cases have been reported"-@DrTedros
"And we must also prepare for other crises, such as the current outbreak of #COVID19"-@DrTedros #DRC

"This is why His Excellency, President Tshisekedi, and his government are taking the steps needed to plan for a #DRC “beyond #Ebola.” But even as we continue to work to end this outbreak, we must act now to ensure there is never another one like it"-@DrTedros
"Earlier this week the Emergency Committee on #Ebola advised me that in their view, the outbreak remains a public health emergency of international concern. I accepted that advice"-@DrTedros #DRC

"Hope is in sight. We are nearing the end of the #Ebola outbreak. Just four cases were reported last week, compared with 120 during one week in April last year. But as long as there is a single case in circulation, the outbreak has not been defeated"-@DrTedros #DRC

"The @UN, WHO, and the wider international community have stood shoulder to shoulder with #DRC. We have joined you in a campaign to strangle the #Ebola virus at its source and contain its spread"-@DrTedros
"The #DRC government has faced this battle head on – led by the @Presidence_RDC - who has himself travelled to affected communities to lead what has become a monumental response"-@DrTedros #Ebola
"Since the #Ebola outbreak began in August 2018, more than 3400 people have contracted the virus and more than 2200 have lost their lives"-@DrTedros #DRC

"Your country’s people have faced many health challenges from malaria, to measles, with one of the most devastating outbreak in the past 50 years, to malnutrition and #Ebola"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #DRC

"I was honoured that President Tshisekedi stood up, among other heads of state, to voice his strong support and commitment for universal health covearage. His vision and enthusiasm for change are why we are here today"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll
"Our road continued to New York, last September, during the #UNGA, when world leaders adopted the first political declaration on universal health coverage"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"Many of you might not know that the path we are taking today started in July 2019 when the President told me during a meeting in Abuja about his determination to ensure universal health coverage in #DRC"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"Today’s Kinshasa Commitment on Universal Health Coverage & the presentation of the national strategy, represent profound and practical steps towards achieving #HealthForAll. President Tshisekedi & WHO have walked a long road together for promoting & protecting health"-@DrTedros

Non-lubricated #condoms increase risk of HIV/STIs because they are more likely to tear and they can cause lesions on the vaginal wall #WorldCondomDay #InternationalCondomDay

WHO recommends that #condoms with Nonoxynol-9 (N-9) spermicidal treatment no longer be promoted due to adverse side effects. N-9 does not provide extra protection against HIV/STI, instead it actually increases the risk of HIV infection when used frequently by high risk women.

AVOID oil-based lubricants such as petroleum jelly, hand lotion, baby oil, or edible oils. These weaken latex #condoms and make them more prone to breakage, therefore making them less effective. #WorldCondomDay #InternationalCondomDay : @epaphotos

#Condom effectiveness depends on user behaviour in opening the package, putting on the condom, type of sexual activity, lubrication, and number of times an individual condom is used. Condoms are designed for single use only. #WorldCondomDay

A very small number of men and women are allergic to latex or to chemicals added to latex - these people should not use latex #condoms. They should be counselled to use synthetic condoms such as polyurethane condoms. #WorldCondomDay
#Condoms can be made of latex, polyurethane, synthetic material, or animal tissue. New male and female condoms are being developed by research teams around the world. #WorldCondomDay : @epaphotos

The female #condom is about the same length as the male condom but is wider for a looser fit, allowing freedom in movement that some say provides a more natural feeling. Lubricant is used on the inside and the outside of female condoms. #WorldCondomDay

DYK: #Condoms are available for men and women. Male condoms are sheaths or coverings that fit over a man's erect penis Female condoms are sheaths, or linings, that fit loosely inside a woman's vagina, made of thin, transparent, soft plastic film #WorldCondomDay : @UNICEF
#Condoms, when used correctly and consistently, are safe and highly effective in: preventing unwanted pregnancy preventing sexually transmitted infections, including HIV #WorldCondomDay

"I’ve spoken before about how we have shipped diagnostic kits to laboratories around the world. We’re also shipping supplies of masks, gloves, gowns to 18 countries, and we have more in the pipeline"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Some of these issues include easy to apply diagnostics, the best approaches for infection prevention, potential therapies that could be used to treat patients, existing vaccine candidates & how to accelerate them, and how to address the infodemic"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"As we speak, research groups are meeting with the leading research funders to start work immediately on the most pressing questions"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"As you know, the research & innovation forum on #COVID19 concluded this afternoon. I was very encouraged to see the energy & speed with which the global research community has taken up this challenge"-@DrTedros

"Instead of directing all our energy against the #COVID19 outbreak, stigma diverts our attention & turns people against each other. I will say it again: this is a time for solidarity, not stigma"-@DrTedros
"Outbreaks can bring out the best & worst in people. Stigmatizing individuals or entire nations does nothing but harm the response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

“The #Westerdam ship will arrive in #Cambodia tomorrow morning. This afternoon I spoke to ’s Minister of Health to thank him for allowing the to dock in his country. This is an example of the intl. solidarity we have consistently been calling for.”-@DrTedros #COVID19

“I’m also pleased to announce that today #Cambodia agreed to accept the #Westerdam , which has been stranded at sea for several days. Based on what we have been told, there are no suspected or confirmed cases of #COVID19 on board the Westerdam”-@DrTedros
“WHO has published guidance on how to handle public health events like this on ships, and we urge countries and companies to follow that guidance.”-@DrTedros #COVID19

“We have also established lines of communication with @IMOHQ, the @cliaglobal and the major cruise operators to ensure we have accurate information and can provide the right advice.”-@DrTedros #COVID19

“Together with the @IMOHQ, we will issue a communique to all countries to respect the principle of “free pratique” for ships and the principle of proper care for all travelers, in accordance with the International Health Regulations.”-@DrTedros #COVID19

“Unfortunately, the #DiamondPrincess is one of three cruise ships that have experienced delayed port clearance or have been denied entry to ports, often without an evidence-based risk assessment.”-@DrTedros #COVID19
“We are in constant contact with the Japanese government, the @IMOHQ, and the owner of the #DiamondPrincess ship to protect the health of all passengers.”-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The number of countries reporting #COVID19 cases has not changed since 4 February. Of the 48 new cases confirmed outside #China yesterday, 40 were on board the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship, which is currently quarantined in Yokohama, "-@DrTedros

"The number of newly confirmed #COVID19 cases reported from #China has declined steadily for the past week, but that must be interpreted with extreme caution. This outbreak could still go in any direction"-@DrTedros
"As of 6am Geneva time this morning, there are 44,730 cases of #COVID19 in #China, with 1,114 deaths. Outside , there are 441 cases from 24 countries, and one death"-@DrTedros

"The current outbreak of #COVID19 highlights why this is so critical. Our greatest fear remains the damage this coronavirus could do in a country like #DRC. Even as the flames of one outbreak begin to die down, we are fighting another fire-front"-@DrTedros

"Tomorrow I will travel to Kinshasa, #DRC for discussions with the President and other senior ministers about how to strengthen ’s health system and protect and promote the health of its people"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

"We can't forget that while #Ebola has killed 2.2k people, #measles has killed 6.3k+ people in , in less time. Only 1/2 of health facilities have access to . Strengthening a health system may not be as sexy as responding to an outbreak, but it's equally important"-@DrTedros

"Nonetheless, the signs are extremely positive in the eastern & I hope that by the time the Emergency Committee reconvenes, we will be able to declare an end to the outbreak. But even as we near the end of the #Ebola outbreak, we must act now to prevent the next one"-@DrTedros

"As I said yesterday, as long as there is a single case of #Ebola in an area as insecure & unstable as eastern #DRC, the potential remains for a much larger epidemic. WHO’s risk assessment is that the risk of spread is high nationally & regionally & low globally"-@DrTedros
"The Emergency Committee on the #Ebola has advised that the outbreak in #DRC continues to be a public health emergency of international concern, and I have accepted that advice"-@DrTedros

WHO recommends that women with #Ebola immediately stop & are prioritised for diagnostic testing. Any exposed to Ebola through breast milk should be placed into safe care, closely monitored for symptoms over a 21-day period & fed with an appropriate breast milk substitute.
